intro: Lomaria patersonii var. pinnatiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lomaria, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a low, spreading growth habit. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to maritime climates. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species in New Zealand's native flora.
